column4: I think the danish support in ubuntu will be more or less similar as it in debian
it looked quite good, but it didn't seem to install OOo in Danish..
yeah, both ff and OO.o have a different system of internationalisation and is not yet supported
so you need to chose the language yourself
Ok.. it's not my own box, I installed Ubuntu for one at an installparty the day before yesterday...
my own box will come one of the following days.. I think :-)
just search for -da in synaptic and you get the correct language packages
Is there a thing like http://packages.debian.org/ for ubuntu?
I can see that it's not in Debian(testing) either.. .well thanks.
you can search in apt-get.org for a deb with firefox-da, but it'll prolly conflict with ubuntu's version of ff though
hoary is supposed to have support for locales for OO.o en ff
that doesn't matter at the moment. Ubuntu didn't configure X proper either, and he's not geeky enough to do that by himself.
then it'll restore the windows bootloader yees
